I’ve read through documents still don’t know what I’m missing

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-03-12T22:45:33.841Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":52,"readers_count":51,"score":40.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":495359,"topic_slug":"help-with-sequential-command","display_username":"Layton","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64705,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/help-with-sequential-command/495359/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3555615,"name":"","username":"griffingreat1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/71e660/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T22:50:48.478Z","cooked":"

Here is an example from our code. ElevatorToL1 is a command, so for you you would create a new command the way you are doing.

new SequentialCommandGroup(
            ElevatorToL1(),
            new WaitUntilCommand(() -> elevatorSubsystem.getError() < 0.25),
            ScorePiece(),
            ElevatorToBottom()        );

It helps to:

  1. Paste a snippet of your code instead of a screenshot
  2. Be more specific about what you’re asking

At any rate, both SequentialCommandGroup and andThen are ways to do commands in sequence. You should probably choose one.

Command command = new SequentialCommandGroup(command1, command2);

OR

Command command = command1.andThen(command2);

Also, you can use Commands.sequence():

Command command = Commands.sequence(command1, command2);

YOur issue is that you have a semicolon at the end of your line instead of a period. You have

New MoveElevator(....);
andThen(...);

You want

New MoveElevator(...).andThen(...);
